<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Express Rider](/Feats.aspx?ID=2126) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Exploration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=66" />
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Move" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=114" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 206 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)

</column>

---

You know how to encourage your mount to cover ground quickly. When calculating your [travel speed](/Rules.aspx?ID=470) for the day while mounted, you can attempt a [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) check to [Command an Animal](/Actions.aspx?ID=58) to increase your mount's travel speed. The DC is determined by the GM, but is typically based on the mount's level or the difficulty of the environment, whichever is harder. On a success, increase your mount's travel speed by half. This has no effect on your mount's movement in encounters.
name: Express Rider
